content_clusters.topic: Employee Grouping and Data Access Control
content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Two articles covering role assignment and task-based role permissions merged into single cluster. Article 14309409786641 covers general role assignment workflow; article 29018269793809 extends this with task-specific role management. Navigation map entry on role management linked as related workflow.

content_clusters.topic: Holiday Calendar and Leave Day Calculation
content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Article 14309464326929 covers public holiday calendar setup; article 14243827423889 covers daily wage calculation configuration. Both affect how leave days are calculated and deducted. Consolidated into single workflow for holiday and wage configuration.

content_clusters.topic: Individual Employee Leave and Probation Management
content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Article 14314012761361 covers activating leave policies for individual employees; article 14312349012753 covers probation date management and its interaction with leave policies. Both operate at employee profile level.
Grouped articles covering the complete leave request lifecycle: submitting, approving, rejecting, editing, and setting up approval hierarchies. Includes both web and mobile app workflows.

content_clusters.topic: Leave Balance Initialization & Hire Date Changes
content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Grouped articles covering leave balance visibility, accrual mechanics, overlapping request detection, and reporting. Spans employee self-service and manager oversight.
Grouped articles covering unpaid leave deduction mechanics, daily pay calculation formulas, and public holiday adjustments. Includes both policy configuration and automatic recalculation workflows.

Grouped articles covering creation, configuration, and management of various leave policies (unpaid leave, work-from-home, general leave policies, probation restrictions, and end-of-service encashment). All share common workflow of navigating Settings > Leaves, creating policies, configuring parameters, and assigning to employees.
Grouped articles covering timesheet recording and days-in-lieu policy setup. Both relate to tracking employee time and converting extra hours into time off.
Single article covering air ticket allowance policy creation and management. Distinct from leave policies but follows similar configuration pattern.
Grouped tickets describing inability to handle complex leave calculations: shift day-offs, negative allowance thresholds, accrual transparency, and working day distinctions.
Single ticket describing lack of hourly leave support, restricting to full-day/half-day only.
Grouped tickets describing lack of UI controls to disable/enable carry-over features and granular carry-over management, requiring backend intervention.
Single ticket describing confusion from multi-level leave policy configurations and lack of transparency in policy vs. employee-level overrides.

Consolidated tickets addressing carry-over allowance configuration limitations: inability to modify for individual cycles, UI restrictions on extreme values, and lack of direct UI modification capability. Multiple tickets report the same underlying feature gap.

content_clusters.topic: Shift Scheduler & Day-Off Integration with Leave Calculations
content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Single ticket addressing inability to dynamically adjust leave calculations based on shift scheduler day-off configurations. System rigidly applies assigned workweek ignoring actual shift schedules.
Grouped tickets addressing minimum leave unit constraints: inability to track sub-half-day leaves (hourly increments) and inability to restrict half-day leaves at policy level.

Consolidated tickets addressing compliance gaps: UAE maternity/sick leave proration conflicts, KSA anniversary-based accrual cycles, and KSA public holiday workweek adjustments. All reflect inability to meet local labor law requirements.
Single ticket addressing lack of flexibility in leave day calculations beyond standard calendar or working day methods, particularly for custom counting rules including non-working days.

Grouped tickets addressing policy modification constraints: rigid validation preventing changes when leave requests conflict, and lack of transparent user communication about automatic background recalculations.
Single ticket addressing UI limitation in handling zero values for maximum encashable days configuration.

detected_integrations.description: Role management controls access to attendance features. Specific roles have permissions to view and manage employee attendance.
Role management controls access to corporate card features and data. Specific roles can manage corporate card assignments and transactions.
Role management controls access to insurance features. Specific roles have permissions to manage employee insurance policies.

Leave policies (unpaid, partially paid) integrate with payroll for automatic salary deductions based on leave taken. Daily wage calculations use basic salary divided by 30 days. End-of-service encashment calculations use payroll settings.
Role management controls access to performance management features. Specific roles can manage performance reviews and evaluations.

Leave policies are configured in Time Off settings. Holiday calendars affect leave day calculations. Leave allowances are activated per employee. Probation dates restrict leave applications during probation period. Employee structures enable automatic employee assignment in leave policies.
Role management controls access to expense tracking features. Specific roles can manage and approve expense reports.
Role management controls access to Muqeem integration features. Specific roles have permissions to manage Muqeem-related data.
Role management controls access to shift scheduling features. Specific roles can create and manage employee shifts.
Leave allowances are configured at employee profile level. Probation dates are set on employee work tab. Employee structures organize employees into groups for policy assignment.
Task management permissions are role-based. Different roles have different task creation, assignment, and update capabilities. Task Manager policy controls task management access.
Leave policies, leave requests, and leave balance tracking are core to the leave management workflow. Policies define allowances and conditions; requests consume leave balance.
Public holiday dates are automatically deducted from working days when calculating daily pay and leave balances. Changes to holiday calendars trigger recalculation of affected leave requests.
Line Manager permissions are assigned through Role Management to control who can approve leave requests.
Leave request submissions trigger notifications to approvers (Line Manager, HR). Request status updates are communicated via email.

detected_integrations.integration: Bayzat Work Life Platform & Mobile App
detected_integrations.description: Timesheets, leave requests, and policy visibility are accessible across web and mobile platforms for cross-platform task tracking and leave management.
Leave reports can be downloaded as Excel files. Reporting hierarchies can be bulk uploaded via Excel templates.
Leave policy deductions require pre-configured employee salaries. Salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) are used for leave encashment calculations.
Probation dates in employee work profiles determine eligibility for leave requests. Probation restrictions on leave policies check this field.
Leave requests require approval from Line Manager or HR. Administrators can submit leave requests on behalf of employees (auto-approved).
Leave policy changes can unassign employees or affect employee-level leave configurations. Policy rollbacks and modifications impact employee leave eligibility.
Lack of audit trail for policy modifications affects compliance tracking and historical data recovery capabilities.
Leave calculations do not account for shift-based day-offs, creating inconsistencies for organizations with complex shift schedules.
Leave calculation system does not dynamically integrate with shift scheduler day-off configurations, preventing accurate leave balance computation for employees with non-standard shift patterns.
Leave balance initialization and cycle recalculation do not automatically trigger when employee hire dates are modified, requiring manual intervention for individual cycle employees.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: No Rollback Mechanism for Leave Policy Changes
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks a native rollback or undo mechanism for leave policy modifications. When policies are changed, employees may be unassigned and historical leave balance data can be erased without recovery options. Changing leave cycle types results in data loss.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Contact configuration team before making policy changes; maintain manual backups of leave data.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Calculation Logic Cannot Handle Complex Scenarios
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform cannot accurately calculate leave for complex workforce scenarios: shift-based day-offs are not excluded from working day calculations, negative allowance thresholds cannot be exceeded, accrual calculations lack transparency to employees, and working day vs. calendar day distinctions are not granular enough.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Manually adjust leave balances for affected employees; use full-day leave policies instead of working day policies for shift-based organizations.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policy Changes Lack Audit Trail and Documentation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform does not provide a user-accessible audit trail for leave policy modifications. Administrators and employees cannot independently view the history of policy changes. Additionally, documentation about leave policy behavior (especially carry-over handling) is insufficient, causing confusion among support teams and users.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Request backend database investigation from support for policy change history; refer to internal documentation for policy behavior clarification.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Request Timing Validation Not Automated
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks automated validation for leave request timing relative to employee absences. Managers must manually review leave history and enforce time-range policies through individual profile checks, creating manual overhead.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Managers should manually review employee leave history before approving requests.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policies Cannot Be Sorted or Prioritized in Employee View
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The employee view displays leave policies in automatic order (by update time) with no ability to manually sort, prioritize, or pin critical policies like annual leave. This reduces usability for employees managing multiple leave types.
The platform only supports full-day or half-day leave requests. Hourly leave is not available, preventing flexible time management and limiting accommodation for nuanced workforce scheduling needs.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Carry-Over Configuration Lacks UI Controls and Flexibility
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform does not provide adequate UI-level controls to enable/disable carry-over features or modify carry-over settings after policy creation. Administrators cannot toggle carry-over allowance or adjust carry-over limits without backend intervention, especially for companies using individual leave cycles.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Contact support for backend modifications to carry-over settings.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Multi-Level Leave Policy Configuration Creates Confusion
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform allows complex, multi-level leave policy configurations (policy-level and employee-level settings) with manual overrides that may not be immediately transparent to administrators. This creates confusion about which settings apply and potential inconsistencies in leave management.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Maintain detailed documentation of policy-level vs. employee-level overrides; conduct regular audits of leave configurations.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform prevents modification of fundamental leave policy attributes after initial creation, including accrual type and leave type status (paid/unpaid). Once a leave policy is configured, users cannot change these core settings without creating a new policy, which creates operational inflexibility and prevents policy evolution as organizational needs change.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Prevents disruption of employee leave balances and historical data integrity

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has multiple restrictions on carry-over allowance configuration: (1) does not support modification for companies with individual leave cycles, (2) UI cannot handle extreme values like unlimited (365 days) carry-over, and (3) users cannot directly modify carry-over settings through the interface without backend intervention. These restrictions prevent companies from implementing flexible leave balance transfer policies aligned with their organizational rules.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Backend or admin intervention required for configuration changes

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks clear, user-facing documentation and transparent calculation displays for leave accrual logic. Users cannot easily understand how pro-rata calculations, conditional leave accrual, and tenure-based entitlements are computed. The system requires manual support team interpretation to explain balance calculations, creating confusion and support burden.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Shift Scheduler Integration with Leave Calculations
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform cannot dynamically adjust leave calculations based on shift scheduler day-off configurations. The system rigidly applies the assigned workweek for leave calculations, ignoring actual shift schedules. This prevents accurate leave balance computation for employees with non-standard shift patterns.

The platform has rigid minimum leave unit constraints: (1) cannot track leave in hourly increments, with 0.5 days being the minimum unit, preventing precise tracking of short-duration emergency leaves, and (2) lacks the ability to configure leave policies with restrictions on half-day leave requests. Administrators cannot set minimum leave duration requirements at the policy level.

The platform lacks native support for multiple regional labor law requirements: (1) automatically prorates leave balances based on hire date, conflicting with UAE requirements for maternity and sick leave full entitlements, (2) does not support KSA-specific sick leave regulations requiring individual, anniversary-based accrual cycles, and (3) cannot automatically adjust public holidays based on employee workweek configuration to provide compensatory days off as required by KSA law. These gaps prevent compliance with local regulatory requirements.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Balance Initialization & Hire Date Recalculation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform cannot automatically calculate leave balance when leave policies are configured before an employee's hire date, especially while the employee is in inactive status. Additionally, the system lacks automatic leave cycle recalculation when an employee's hire date is modified, particularly for companies using individual leave cycles. Both scenarios require manual intervention to update leave policy assignments and cycle dates.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Manual intervention required to update leave policy assignments and cycle dates

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform cannot consolidate or link leave salary requests that are split across different leave cycles. This forces administrators to manually track and approve multiple related requests separately, creating administrative burden and potential for inconsistent handling of leave salary calculations.

The platform lacks flexibility in calculating leave days beyond standard calendar or working day calculations. It cannot automatically handle custom leave counting rules that include non-working days, limiting organizations' ability to implement leave policies aligned with their specific operational requirements.

The platform has rigid validation rules preventing policy modifications when existing leave requests conflict with proposed changes. The system does not automatically reconcile or adjust leave balances during policy reconfiguration. Additionally, users lack clear communication about automatic recalculations triggered by administrative changes, leaving them unaware when system actions modify leave requests in the background.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Encashable Days Zero Value UI Handling
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has a known user interface limitation in handling zero values for maximum encashable days. The system fails to correctly interpret and display encashable days when the policy is configured with zero maximum days, creating confusion about leave encashment eligibility.
